page.title: 11ENTERTAINMENT IN WYCOMBE
page.content: Today in High Wycombe there are no {cinemas.}But before, High Wycombe had about four cinemas.{The Palace Cinema which was in Frogmoor was demolished, so that some large stores could be built. It was built in 1969 in September. It was built in a converted Methodist Chapel. But in 1973 it was burnt and had to be built again. The {Electroscope Theatre}in Oxford Road was closed in 1930 and then demolished in 1969, to make more room for the rebuilding of the King's Head. High Wycombe has no theatre now,since the{Intimate Theatre}in Frogmore was converted into offices. There are two{Bingo halls,}several Disco halls and{night clubs.}Otherwise people have to go elsewhere for entertainment. { }
